intro: Anthospermum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf anthospermum, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Anthospermum lanceolatum is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
